Method Detail

getId

public byte getId()
Specified by:
getId in interface PenDevice
Returns:
A unique and constant id. This id is assigned at runtime by the PenManager and can change between restarts.
See Also:
PenDevice.getPhysicalId()

penManagerSetId

public void penManagerSetId(byte id)
Description copied from interface: PenDevice
Don't call this method. It is only for use by the PenManager. This method is called when the device is being constructed to set a meaningful id.

Specified by:

getPhysicalId

public java.lang.String getPhysicalId()
Specified by:
getPhysicalId in interface PenDevice
Returns:
A unique and constant id. This physicalId is always the same for the given device, even if the program restarts. Each PenDevice has a different physicalId.

getUseFractionalMovements

public boolean getUseFractionalMovements()
Specified by:
getUseFractionalMovements in interface PenDevice
Returns:
true if this device uses fractional (floating point precision) movement levels.

penManagerSetUseFractionalMovements

public void penManagerSetUseFractionalMovements(boolean useFractionalMovement)
Description copied from interface: PenDevice
Don't call this method. It is only for use by the PenManager. This method is called when the provider PenProvider.getUseRelativeLocationFilter() is true and this PenDevice must change its useFractionalMovement mode.

Specified by:
penManagerSetUseFractionalMovements in interface PenDevice
See Also:
PenDevice.getUseFractionalMovements()
